trans-unit.source: Specifies which parts are included in a message.
This specification is used to indicate which message parts need to be signed and which parts need to be encrypted.
Initializes an empty <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref>.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref> and specifies whether the message body is included.
Initializes whether the message body is included in the specification.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref> with an array of message headers.
Each header is specified using its name and namespace.
The array of header types to use.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref> with an array of message headers.
Each header is specified using its name and namespace.
In addition, the `isBodyIncluded` parameter specifies whether the message body is to be included or not.
Initializes whether the message body is included in the specification.
The array of header types to use.
Clears the list of headers in this specification.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref> is read only.
Gets the header types for this specification.
An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601> that holds the header types for this message specification.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the message body is included in this specification.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the message body is included in this specification; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref> is read only.
Gets a value that indicates whether the specification is read only.
You can use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification.MakeReadOnly%2A> to set this property to `true`.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification.Clear%2A> sets the property to `false`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specification is read only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Sets the specification to read only.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification.Clear%2A> removes all headers in the specification and makes the collection read/write.
Gets an empty instance of this class.
If this property is `null`, a new empty instance of this class is created.
An empty instance of this class.
Merges two message part specifications.

After the Union method is called, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification> holds all header information from both specifications, and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification.IsBodyIncluded%2A> property is set to the logical OR of both specifications.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref> to merge.
This <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessagePartSpecification"></xref> is read only.
specification is .
